name: Evening Reflection - First Day Complete
content: Lena preparing dinner at base camp after successful first day, temperature dropping to minus 2°C. Cooking dehydrated beef stew outside tent following carbon monoxide safety protocols. Processed day's experiences: initial solitude concerns transformed into appreciation for escape from six months of city stress and professional demands. No external pressures - emails, meetings, or obligations. Deeply satisfied by chamois encounter, mentally replaying the experience. Planning tomorrow's potential 2600m peak attempt contingent on weather assessment, emphasizing safety over summit achievement. Appreciated simple pleasures: budget camp meal tasting extraordinary due to hunger and effort. Preparing for cold night with minus-15 sleeping bag, anticipating better sleep than at home. Expressing gratitude for remaining six days, recognizing trip's restorative value for emotional wellbeing.
summary: Evening reflection: cooked dinner, processed solitude benefits, relived wildlife encounter, planned conditional summit attempt
background_sounds: stove hissing, wind, tent fabric, water boiling
